columns.name: route_table_id
columns.description: The ID of the route table containing the route.

columns.name: state
columns.description: The state of the route. The blackhole state indicates that the route's target isn't available (for example, the specified gateway isn't attached to the VPC, or the specified NAT instance has been terminated).

columns.name: destination_cidr_block
columns.description: The IPv4 CIDR block used for the destination match.

columns.name: destination_ipv6_cidr_block
columns.description: The IPv6 CIDR block used for the destination match.

columns.name: carrier_gateway_id
columns.description: The ID of the carrier gateway.

columns.name: destination_prefix_list_id
columns.description: The prefix of the AWS service.

columns.name: egress_only_internet_gateway_id
columns.description: The ID of the egress-only internet gateway.

columns.name: gateway_id
columns.description: The ID of a gateway attached to your VPC.

columns.name: instance_id
columns.description: The ID of a NAT instance in your VPC.

columns.name: instance_owner_id
columns.description: The AWS account ID of the owner of the instance.

columns.name: local_gateway_id
columns.description: The ID of the local gateway.

columns.name: nat_gateway_id
columns.description: The ID of a NAT gateway.

columns.name: network_interface_id
columns.description: The ID of the network interface.

columns.name: transit_gateway_id
columns.description: The ID of a transit gateway.

columns.name: vpc_peering_connection_id
columns.description: The ID of a VPC peering connection.

columns.name: origin
columns.description: Describes how the route was created. CreateRouteTable - The route was automatically created when the route table was created. CreateRoute - The route was manually added to the route table. EnableVgwRoutePropagation - The route was propagated by route propagation.
